channel.title: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops
channel.description:
Runescape now has the ability to be played in Fullscreen with [b]AND[/B] without HD. The Standard Definition has also been changed to look better, such as the ground textures blending with each other.
Auto casting can now be used without staves, and with the more powerful staves, the magic damage is increased by 10%. You may now also Autocast the God spells (Flames of Zamorak, Claws of Guthix and Saradomin Strike). The magic interfaces (Modern/Ancient) has been updated to enable the use of autocasting.
RuneScape shops are now personalised for every player. The amount of stock you see in each shop is now unique to your account and, therefore, no longer affected by the actions of other players.
A picture of FullScreen in Standard Definition: [url=http://i700.photobucket.com/albums/ww4/primadude12/fullscreensd.png]http://i700.photobucket.com/albums/ww4/primadude12/fullscreensd.png[/url]
A picture of the new Graphics Settings interface:
[img]http://i700.photobucket.com/albums/ww4/primadude12/graphicssettingsinterface.png[/img]
A picture of the new Modern Magiks interface:
[img]http://i700.photobucket.com/albums/ww4/primadude12/magicinterface.png[/img]
A picture of the Ancient Magiks interface will be posted soon.
RuneTek 5 Game Engine Update: [url=http://news.runescape.com/newsitem.ws?id=2171]http://news.runescape.com/newsitem.ws?id=2171[/url] Changes to Autocasting Spells Update: [url=http://news.runescape.com/newsitem.ws?id=2172]http://news.runescape.com/newsitem.ws?id=2172[/url] Personalised Shops Update: [url=http://news.runescape.com/newsitem.ws?id=2168]http://news.runescape.com/newsitem.ws?id=2168[/url]
[u]Discuss[/u].

item.title: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:32, topic:299621”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=395928.msg2952921#msg2952921 date=1252645667]
Not really with a signed client (pretty much equivalent to an application) and hardware acceleration. The only limit is memory.
[/quote]
Also, the memory limit is the memory available to the computer, since as on Java 6 Update 10 you can pass the maximum heap size like this:

<param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx128M">

Interesting update, in that case there are no limitations. Anything a java application do a java applet should be able to do as well.

Read full topic

Not really with a signed client (pretty much equivalent to an application) and hardware acceleration. The only limit is memory.

item.title: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops
item.dc:creator: @MnJu MnJu
item.description:
@MnJu wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:6, topic:299621”]Lothy, text above heads is different, I can see it.

Also the members advert disappears if you log into a members world,
SD in fullscreen is SO MUCH LAGGIER than HD fullscreen
I don’t like the custom cursor they have
the custom shops idea is retarded
On the world switching interface from the login screen, msot of the options now has an “RS” flag? What’s that for…

EDIT: just noticed that if you right click on something and hover over an option that’s not “walk here” or “cancel” a circle appears over your cursor, with the very same cursor in the middle? What the hell is the point in that…[/quote]

My laptop can run SD fullscreen perfectly, but HD fullscreen lags. Neither of them lag on my desktop.
The RuneScape flags are obviously the servers located in England, or just anonymous servers.
And just turn off custom cursors if you don’t like them.

Read full topic
item.source: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops

item.title: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:26, topic:299621”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=395928.msg2941234#msg2941234 date=1251903226]

Lothy, text above heads is different, I can see it.

Also the members advert disappears if you log into a members world,
SD in fullscreen is SO MUCH LAGGIER than HD fullscreen
I don’t like the custom cursor they have
the custom shops idea is retarded
On the world switching interface from the login screen, msot of the options now has an “RS” flag? What’s that for…

EDIT: just noticed that if you right click on something and hover over an option that’s not “walk here” or “cancel” a circle appears over your cursor, with the very same cursor in the middle? What the hell is the point in that…

Chances are that fullscreen SD still uses software rendering, hence why it’d be slower than using a GPU to render the game.
[/quote]
that doesnt make since because I assume the purpose of SD is to be used on older computers.[/quote]

And older computers don’t have accelerated graphics cards to run HD. So what part of my sentence doesn’t make sense to you?

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Lothy:

That’s what I don’t understand. Does WoW have such a ridiculously stupid player base? I suppose I wouldn’t be surprised if it does, but I really hope WoW’s player base is at least a bit better.

Well… WoW is owned by Activision-Blizzard - so it’s public, really.

I doubt any of the online whiners own enough of a share in it to be able to direct anything, though.

Read full topic
item.source: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops

item.title: Runescape Update: Game Engine, Changes to Autocasting & Personalised Shops
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:299621”]Well, you can’t blame jagex for sitting on their hands, anymore…

Back when I played runescape they never updated anything, ever.[/quote]
As a company they can’t win, as far as I’m concerned.

For some reason all of the players think it’s their god given right to choose the direction of the game, as if they were stakeholders or something.
Everyone overlooks the fact that Jagex Ltd is in fact a private company, and the only people with a say at all are Andrew, Paul, and any of the original developers that worked on it while it was a ‘garage project’ of sorts and invested something in it.

That’s what I don’t understand. Does WoW have such a ridiculously stupid player base? I suppose I wouldn’t be surprised if it does, but I really hope WoW’s player base is at least a bit better.

[quote=“Davidude, post:21, topic:299621”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=395928.msg2941286#msg2941286 date=1251905601]

RuneScape are now personalised for every player. The amount of stock you see in each shop is now unique to your account and, therefore, no longer affected by the actions of other players.

Terrible, terrible change.
[/quote]
What the fuck, I miss the days when runescape was a mutliplayer game.[/quote]
I agree. They’ve taken some pretty draconian measures to stop the problems (which really are problems given the size of the game… A lot of people don’t see the full picture before complaining about things; there are others that use the game, for example, but most players only comment on things with ‘me me me’ in mind), and I’m not fond of that.

While I wouldn’t call it ‘single player’ just yet, it isn’t far from it. Practically every aspect of the game has been de-personalised.
There’s 2 quests that I’m aware of that require at least one partner to complete the quest.
I get by in the game with a practically empty friend list; there’s no reason to get to know anybody, no reason to join clans anymore, etc.

They know the root of the problem is ultimately the fundamental flaw in their game though, and that’s the fact that it is a grindy game, quite possibly by design.
Nobody wants to grind, so what do they do? They automate tasks. It’s quicker to spend 20 hours as a newish to intermediate programmer working out their client and developing automation tools for it than it is to spend about 60 - 70 hours maxing a single skill like cooking (notably one of the quickest skills to train once shark cooking is viable), or fletching.
It’s even longer for the average player unless they’ve invested significant time in the game to acquire resources.

I think that one of their biggest goals for Mechscape, Stellar Dawn or whatever it turns out to be will be to alleviate or completely eliminate all grind-type playing. With this change they can probably quite safely have things such as uncapped trading, an unhindered market, and so on.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:19, topic:299621”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=395928.msg2942087#msg2942087 date=1251944704]
i cant care to enlighten us?
[/quote]
You can’t because they haven’t. Everyone that tries to liken runescape to WoW on the RS forums is completely full of shit and clueless with regards to the content matter of their posts.

WoW is class based, Runescape lets its players do absolutely anything and doesn’t lock them out of certain aspects of the game; they both take very different approaches and are very different in gameplay.[/quote]

My friend who is a complete WoW fag tells me that the only similarities between runescape & WoW is the custom cursor.

Read full topic
